top_categories.workout_context: At mile 60 of 127, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Belgian Waffle Ride Cedar City's 75% gravel/dirt, 25% pavement, Playground-type sand sectors forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 127 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Belgian Waffle Ride Cedar City's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
6,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 127 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
51ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Belgian Waffle Ride Cedar City, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
At Belgian Waffle Ride Cedar City, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Belgian Waffle Ride Cedar City. Train it until it feels boring.
127 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on fast-rolling gravel with hidden treachery. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 6,500ft of climbing on fast-rolling gravel with hidden treachery does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.heat: June in Cedar City, Utah — Early April at 5,600+ ft means below-freezing starts are common. 2024 had 'snowing sideways' pre-race day with freezing temps, high winds, and snow on run-in. Good years warm to 50s-60s°F. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Belgian Waffle Ride Cedar City — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day. Race-day realities: Dehydration risk once sun and pace pick up.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Belgian Waffle Ride Cedar City’s 127 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Belgian Waffle Ride Cedar City. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Belgian Waffle Ride Cedar City demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride fast-rolling gravel with hidden treachery at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: 75% gravel/dirt, 25% pavement, playground-type sand sectors, fast ranch roads. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 127 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 127 miles of fast-rolling gravel with hidden treachery in Cedar City, Utah.
